CatDescriptText: Mr. Howard Sprague, 25 Wooster Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?"  Answer reads: "As far as I see, the NAACP, is doing a good job, that is, as much as can be expected because it does not have a whole lot of support."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Howard Sprague wearing light colored cap standing in front of granite building with "...EWA..." on side and intersection in background, Downtown
